title: Guitar
description: I have been playing the guitar ever since I was 14 years old, and it is one of my greatest passions. I am a die-hard fan of the progressive rock group Dream Theater, and I have meticulously studied their music over the years, particularly their guitar work. I like to think that I'm pretty good at playing the guitar - below are a couple of guitar covers I'm particulary proud of. Of course, there's always room for improvement, and I am always practicing and mixing to get better technique and sound.

title: Literature
description: When I was younger, I used to be a voracious reader - now, I still read when I can. I love literature, and perhaps in another life I would have liked to broaden my literary knowledge. Below are some works that have stayed with me over the years...

notes.name: Dulce et decorum est - Wilfred Owen
notes.description: A chilling anti-war poem written by Wilfred Owen, a young British poet who died before the end of WWI. It described graphically the death of one of his comrades brought about by mustard gas.

notes.name: Stoner - John Williams
notes.description: A fantastic story, Stoner simply tells the remarkably ordinary story of an ordinary man. It is a celebration of a human life.

notes.name: Catch-22 - Joseph Heller
notes.description: What is there to say? Catch-22 is a classic for a reason. It is hilarious...

notes.name: Tortilla Flat - John Steinbeck
notes.description: My grandfather was a well-read man, and Steinbeck was his favourite author. I always remember him when I read Steinbeck. Most of his works are profoundly sad and leave me feeling empty and enriched at the same time...
